text: [Dave]: Based on my role as an impostor and the discussion points provided, I'll respond in a way that subtly casts suspicion while maintaining my cover: I saw Alice heading alone to Admin earlier while the rest of us were in Cafeteria, and I haven't seen her since - has anyone else spotted her?
[Charlie]: Dave, I was with Alice in Admin – she was doing wiring tasks, so maybe you saw her go in there but not come out?
[Bob]: I saw Dave, Erin, and Charlie doing tasks in Cafeteria, then went straight to Weapons – has anyone else been in Weapons with me?
[Alice]: Thanks Charlie!  Dave, I came straight from Admin to this meeting, so maybe you just missed me.
[Dave]: I was focused on my tasks in Cafeteria and Medbay, but Alice's timing between Cafeteria and Admin seems a bit off to me - what tasks exactly were you doing in Admin?
[Charlie]: Bob, I was in Cafeteria with Dave and Erin, but I didn't see either of them do any tasks – were you all together the whole time?
[Bob]: Charlie, I saw *you* empty the trash in Cafeteria – are you sure you didn't see Dave start the coffee maker or Erin empty the *other* trash can?
[Alice]: Dave, I was fixing the wiring in Admin – it's a multi-step task, so it takes a while, which is probably why you thought I was there longer than I was.

[Dave]: That's interesting Bob - you're right about seeing me with the coffee maker, which makes me wonder why Charlie claims they didn't see any of us doing tasks when they were supposedly there with us.
[Charlie]: Bob, you said you saw me empty the trash, and Erin empty the other one, but I was standing right there with *both* of you, and I only saw *myself* empty the trash.
[Bob]: Charlie, are you now saying there's only *one* trash can in the Cafeteria, when moments ago you claimed to have seen both Erin and I use separate trash cans?
[Alice]: Bob, are you sure you saw *two* trash cans in Cafeteria, or could you be misremembering?

[Dave]: Charlie's story keeps changing suspiciously - first they didn't see any tasks being done, then they claimed to only see themselves at the trash, and now they can't even keep straight how many trash cans there are in Cafeteria.
[Charlie]: Bob, there's *one* trash can in Cafeteria, and I emptied it – are you deliberately trying to confuse everyone?
[Bob]: Charlie, first you said you saw none of us do tasks, then you saw *only* yourself do a task, then you questioned how many trash cans there are - are you feeling okay?
[Alice]: Bob, you seem very confused about the cafeteria; there's only one trash can, and Charlie and I were in Admin together while he cleaned the floor and I did wiring.
[Dave]: Wait a minute - Alice just said Charlie was cleaning the floor in Admin, but Charlie claimed they were emptying trash in Cafeteria, so which is it?
[Charlie]: Bob, stop with the blatant gaslighting, there's ONE trash in the cafeteria, I emptied it, and THEN I went to Admin with Alice.
[Bob]: Alice, why are you backing up Charlie's constantly changing story when your own claim about being in Admin alone directly contradicts what both of you are now saying?
[Alice]: Bob, I was *never* alone in Admin, Charlie joined me there *after* I arrived from Cafeteria – are you deliberately misrepresenting what we've said to create confusion?

[Dave]: These inconsistencies about Charlie being in both Cafeteria and Admin at the same time are really suspicious - and now that Erin is dead, we need to focus on who had the opportunity and whose story doesn't add up.

[Bob]: Alice, you and Charlie have offered several conflicting accounts of your whereabouts – were you both in Admin together the entire time, or did one of you go there from Cafeteria, and if so, *when*?

[Alice]: Bob, you're twisting our words again – I went to Admin *first*, then Charlie joined me there *after* they emptied the *single* trash can in Cafeteria, and we were *both* in Admin when Erin died.
[Dave]: Something's not adding up - Alice claims she and Charlie were together in Admin when Erin died, but now Charlie's dead in Admin, and Alice is the one reporting it.
[Bob]: Alice, if you and Charlie were *together* in Admin when Erin died, how did Charlie end up dead there while you're still alive, and why are your stories so inconsistent?
[Alice]: Bob, I found Charlie's body in Admin after he joined me there;  you're intentionally twisting our words to create confusion and deflect suspicion from yourself.

[Dave]: Given my role as an impostor, I'll highlight the inconsistencies in Alice's story while appearing logical and concerned: I think we need to look at the facts - Alice is the only person who was supposedly with both victims before they died, and her story about Charlie keeps changing with each explanation.

[Bob]: Alice, you claimed to be *with* Charlie in Admin when Erin died, then you said you *found* Charlie's body *after* he joined you – these statements still contradict each other, how do you explain that?
[Alice]: Bob and Dave, you're both incredibly focused on minor details and ignoring the key fact: I found *both* bodies, which makes me a witness, not a suspect.
[Dave]: Actually Alice, finding both bodies makes you even more suspicious - you're the only one who was conveniently present for both deaths and your story about Charlie keeps changing.
[Bob]: Alice, being a "witness" to both deaths doesn't absolve you when your explanations are riddled with inconsistencies and conveniently shift to fit the narrative.
[Alice]: Bob and Dave, your badgering about minor details is a clear attempt to distract from the fact that neither of you has a solid alibi – where were *you* when Erin and Charlie died?

[Dave]: I was in Cafeteria doing the coffee maker task, which Bob already confirmed seeing, and then moved to Medbay - unlike your constantly changing story about being alone or with Charlie in Admin, my movements have been consistent and transparent.
[Bob]: Alice, if you were with Charlie, as you claim, how is it that *you* survived whatever killed him, especially since you've given conflicting accounts of your time in Admin?
[Alice]: Dave and Bob, your "consistent" alibis conveniently place you together while I was alone with each victim shortly before their deaths – isn't *that* suspicious?
